Author: HODLtheLINE
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Question:    Answer:  Privacy is highly prized by bidders and sellers alike in the arts & collectibles space, which is why no title registry currently exists in the market. The lack of title registry hampers the ability to buy, sell, insure, and lend against the asset class, as well as prevent bad actors. By placing provenance on the blockchain and building a separate product to handle auctioning of the assets, we will be able to provide an immutable transaction history of the piece of art while still protecting the bidders and sellers’ privacy.

Author: HODLtheLINE
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Question:    Answer:  "Biddable uses a Smart Escrow solution to handle the problems faced by bidders and sellers, bringing verified trust to both parties. Smart Escrow is a deposit-escrow system wherein both the title and a cryptocurrency deposit is escrowed from the seller and the buyer. This enables buyers to prove their intention to pay to the seller while maintaining their privacy. Meanwhile, it keeps sellers honest by escrowing the title, without which the item would lose value. This system parallels the escrow system used in many real estate transactions."

Author: mexi.db
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: One of the biggest drivers of an item’s value is its provenance. Provenance is the history of ownership and identity of an object. It can include auction houses, dealers, or galleries that have sold an item, the private or institutional collections in which the item has been held, and exhibitions where the item has been displayed. It can also include academic research and catalogue raisonné inclusion.  Why does provenance matter? https://medium.com/codexprotocol/how-provenance-affects-the-value-of-art-collectibles-51fa1269f215

Author: shinharu10282016
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex = decentralized registry of unique arts and assets?  I get your point but how are you supposed to monitor if those registered in your project are still alive after some years? Most of the unique art and assets are smuggled and bought by some rich guy from somewhere. Or it might be destroyed in some house fire or someone stole it and kept it themselves. So how?

Author: TheRedCanary
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Hi there, can you please clarify: "how are you supposed to monitor if those registered in your project are still alive after some years?" I do not understand this question.  "Most of the unique art and assets are smuggled and bought by some rich guy from somewhere." - This is not very accurate.  Actually, there are auction houses/museums/collectors, that will benefit to use Codex. And this is who Codex is looking to pursue.   If an item is "smuggled and bought by some rich guy", they will likely not use Codex, as the history would expose them. So this is not really a concern for Codex.  In case there is a fire or stolen item, there are what is referred to as "behavioral incentives" which will sync the registry with physical items.  If you are interested in reading more, please check out the whitepaper: https://docsend.com/view/n4sbws8

Author: EyeofthebeHODLer
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Biddable is one of the first applications built on the Codex Protocol and you can now use it on LiveAuctioneers  It's a Simple Three-Step Process  1: Acquire cryptocurrency. Biddable takes deposits using Ethereum.  2: Leave a refundable deposit that will be held in a secure smart contract.  3: When you win an item, settle your invoice in fiat or cryptocurrency.  What you need  1: The Metamask browser extension or another way to manually transfer your deposit.  2: Enough Ethereum (ETH) cryptocurrency tokens to meet the required amount.  https://www.liveauctioneers.com/pages/biddable/

Author: EyeofthebeHODLer
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: In Case you missed it:  What has traditionally been the process for preserving the value of your art and collectibles assets? Ivan, Private Collector, provides his experience.  "So, assessing the value of your pieces over time is very important, and I would say, the best advice I was given by one of the persons who restores my painting is 'You need to catalog everything.'  So that's the first part. So that you record everything, you don't lose the provenance history right where you bought it, how much you paid for it, did you have any document that went with it, the catalog of the auction, you know. All these things. But also, so that you can document these things, and when the time comes that you need to sell these things, or somebody else for you —  that it's all documented right.     The second purpose is that collections as a whole have more value than individual lots, taken individually. So there must be some logic to a collection that adds to the value of individual lots.  The third element is that once you catalog things, the, you can get them exhibited. And, getting a lot out that you bought, exhibited, adds to their value, tremendously. Because you increase the documentation about it, you make them more famous, per se, and, and by doing that, you increase the value of your assets.  So that's a very important dimension. By cataloging, you can get advice on how to re-balance your collection, get rid of pieces that, you know, honestly are not that good, or maybe are fake, so you can you can also exchange and communicate and then have external advice. External people tell you well, 'We think this is really good, we think this is really bad,' and reassess.  Watch the full video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cQNBpSiOeSk  Want to learn more? Visit the website: http://codexprotocol.com/ Join the Telegram for latest updates: https://t.me/codexprotocol Follow Codex Protocol on Twitter: https://twitter.com/CodexProtocol

Author: EyeofthebeHODLer
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Question: Is there direct communication ability between artist and art buyer?  Answer: "Codex is the registry which tracks the identity of the item over time. This information is incredibly important for lots of different use-cases. One use-case is an application that facilitates communication between artists and buyers (either for art, wine, cars, or other unique assets). Let's call this a Marketplace use-case. Codex does not itself provide direct communication between artist/creator and buyer but one could build an application on top of codex that facilitates that!"

Author: JanuaryN
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Why upload art onto the blockchain?  Here’s why artists are creating records / tokenized assets for their artworks and how a blockchain-based catalogue raisonné benefits artists.      Allows the artist to ‘stay in touch’ with the work and see the piece change ownership over time     Immutable records deter the creation of fakes and forgeries     Catalogues prevent manipulation of an artist’s market     Applications built using non-fungible tokens (NFTs) could enable tracking of resale royalty payments     Selling artworks with blockchain records enables the owner of the piece to access a wealth of services, like insurance, appraisals, and more  https://medium.com/codexprotocol/how-to-create-a-codex-record-a2f1329948c1

Author: mexi.db
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex Protocol and the Foundation for Art and Blockchain have organized The Dogethereum Bridge #ArtProject which opens in Vancouver, May 2019. The project invites the public inside an immersive realm informative of the remarkable journey early crypto pioneers forged and the bridges they’ve built.  https://medium.com/codexprotocol/bridging-blockchains-with-art-the-dogethereum-bridge-artproject-74de3ae2f73f  "Projects like the Dogethereum Bridge #ArtProject will invite the public inside an immersive realm informative of the remarkable journey early crypto pioneers forged, the bridges they’ve built, and the satisfaction obtained upon realizing that maybe we should aspire to create decentralized utopias, and perhaps we are.  Successful prototypes developed at the #ArtProject Maker Space will be displayed inside the Dogethereum bridge #ArtProject at the Vancouver Biennale in May 2019. The structure will serve as a hub for education that promotes the adoption of blockchain technology and will represent a moment-in-time in a rapidly evolving technological era."

If we get the most votes we will be awarded with a FREE KuCoin listing and a marketing package to go with it. Being one of the few blockchain projects with a working product, let’s all get together and make sure Codex gets even more exposure!  How to Vote:  1. Sign up to KuCoin and create an account. Your account needs to be verified, 2FA activated and hold at least 1 KCS in order for your vote to count  2. Join the competition’s Telegram channel: https://t.me/Kucoin2ndtelegramcompetition  3. Follow the instructions in the pinned post. The voting system is automated, so things will be super easy for you.  Make sure you READ THE PINNED POST, so you know   what to expect, you will have to start a private     conversation with our voting bot, it will take care of the   rest!  4. Fill the fields our bot sends you in the private chat, you will be asked the following:     a. What is Your KuCoin Account Email Address (remember  this account must be verified, have 2FA enabled and hold at least 1 KCS for your vote to count)     b. Project Name You Want To Get Listed (just choose the project from the list)  NOTE: The more KCS your account holds the more your vote will count! Each account gets 1 vote per KCS with a maximum cap of 1000 voted per account i.e:  1 KCS… 1 vote 2 KCS… 2 votes 3 KCS… 3 votes 1000 KCS… 1000 votes  Make sure you keep the KCS in your account at least for 7 days after the competition is finished to allow our admins to account for fake accounts and tally the votes effectively.  The competition goes live on September 27th 18.00 UTC+8 and voting will remain open until September 30th 18.00 UTC+8.

Author: imma24
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Modifying Codex Records requires fees payable in CodexCoin. This is analogous to gas in Ethereum. It’s also similar to the 0x Protocol where makers and takers pay fees in ZRX (the 0x token) to relayers to exchange tokens. Operations to read data are completely free, but operations to create, update, and transfer Codex Records have an associated fee depending on the type of modification. For example, adding a lien on a registered item may cost more than a transfer of title operation. Fees will be used to replenish a community pool that is used for rewards. It is not intended that these fees should be burdensome for any one individual. Rather, they will be relevant for stakeholders who use the protocol in volume for commercial use, like app developers and auction houses.

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: What has traditionally been the process for preserving the value of your art and collectibles assets? Ivan, Private Collector, provides his experience.  "So, assessing the value of your pieces over time is very important, and I would say, the best advice I was given by one of the persons who restores my painting is 'You need to catalog everything.'  So that's the first part. So that you record everything, you don't lose the provenance history right where you bought it, how much you paid for it, did you have any document that went with it, the catalog of the auction, you know. All these things. But also, so that you can document these things, and when the time comes that you need to sell these things, or somebody else for you —  that it's all documented right.     The second purpose is that collections as a whole have more value than individual lots, taken individually. So there must be some logic to a collection that adds to the value of individual lots.  The third element is that once you catalog things, the, you can get them exhibited. And, getting a lot out that you bought, exhibited, adds to their value, tremendously. Because you increase the documentation about it, you make them more famous, per se, and, and by doing that, you increase the value of your assets.  So that's a very important dimension. By cataloging, you can get advice on how to re-balance your collection, get rid of pieces that, you know, honestly are not that good, or maybe are fake, so you can you can also exchange and communicate and then have external advice. External people tell you well, 'We think this is really good, we think this is really bad,' and reassess.  Watch the full video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cQNBpSiOeSk  Want to learn more? Visit the website: http://codexprotocol.com/ Join the Telegram for latest updates: https://t.me/codexprotocol Follow Codex Protocol on Twitter: https://twitter.com/CodexProtocol

Author: GreenSkyTrails
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles

It goes into how Codex Coins will operate on the protocol, as well as various incentives, rewards, and staking opportunities that work through Codex Coins  https://medium.com/codexprotocol/the-codexcoin-economy-f71abf1937c8

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Authentic art or forgery?  "I have doubts on photos, many, many times. I would say, fakes, they're everywhere. People even say that, in the Museum of Fine Arts, two-thirds of them are fake. Because it's very, very difficult, and even experts don't always agree. I have another story, it was the person who restores my art in Paris. She had two pieces that, she's been restoring paintings forever, right, for museums and she said 'honestly, these two were as right' you know, the two were absolutely right according to her estimate. But she called the expert, the world expert, there's one identified person who identifies these. This person walks in the room, and from ten feet away says, 'The one on the left is right, the one on the right is wrong, uh, is fake.' And that's it."  Watch the full video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m6ziByRx-Jg  Want to learn more?  Visit the website: http://codexprotocol.com/ Join the Telegram for latest updates: https://t.me/co Follow Codex Protocol on Twitter: https://twitter.com/CodexProtocoldexprotocol

Author: ribenapurpz
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Hi guys there is an update here https://medium.com/codexprotocol/codexcoin-sale-update-airdrop-3af53c6a5e9b  The Codex sale is no longer being continued  At Codex, we believe wholeheartedly that for our technology to reach its full potential, we must see it distributed as widely as possible. Decentralization is the heart of the crypto movement and we have always endeavored to foster a sense of democracy in our project and build a strong community. That’s why, even though we have raised USD$12 million to date, an amount we believe is sufficient to build the protocol successfully, we opened up the sale to community participation (to the extent allowable by law) — because community engagement and user adoption, especially in the form of token distribution, is our first priority. Thank you to the more than 3,000+ community supporters who believe in our vision and completed the exhaustive KYC process to be able to participate.  Over the first three days of our community sale, the contributions we received were highly concentrated and we have not seen a broad enough pool of purchasers participate in the sale to meet our goals for distribution. Given this, and on the advice of our advisers, we have decided to cancel our token sale and instead proceed with the most democratic option possible — a token airdrop to the community.  The first airdrop will be to the 3,500+ community members who successfully passed our KYC process and provided us with a token wallet address. Those members will each receive an airdrop of 500 CodexCoin tokens (CODX). Purchasers who bought as part of the public sale will each receive a refund of the ETH they contributed along with an additional airdrop of 2,000 CodexCoin. We expect to do further airdrops in the future, so this is just the beginning. Please note that details are not yet finalized so this information is subject to change. We will announce further details as soon as possible.   Quote from: petya.millionnyj on July 27, 2018, 07:18:23 PM Hello friends) please clarify one moment for me) What's bonus for participating right now? Quote from: Misha87 on July 27, 2018, 06:28:12 PM When does the sale end? I want to use your solution!

We are unique because we have an adoption. Codex has agreements that give it support from and access to thousands of auction houses that sell 10 million items annually for over $6 Billion''.

Author: ribenapurpz
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: The smart contract was audited by Hosho, confirmed by Andreas in the Codex team    Quote from: keepeye on July 26, 2018, 05:47:36 PM I am interested in name of the project? Who created it? And, one more moment, who is designer of the website?  There is a story behind the name that Jess and Mark came up with:  A Codex is itself a collectible object. Because codices were handwritten, there were few copies of any single codex, and sometimes only a single copy. This makes them rare and often significant. A Codex was used to record important information - just as The Codex Protocol will record important information for collectors. “Code” is a nod to cryptography which underpins blockchain technology as well as to writing code for software applications.  The teams Sebastian Tory-Pratt , Design Lead is the one pulling the strings on the website front.

I don't think blockchain will change this.  I think that people should be entitled to share what they want and be private about what they want.  In Codex, users control the privacy of their data.  That's one of the greatest benefits of the blockchain.  Blockchain also ensures that the source of any information they do share is verified.  https://t.me/codexprotocol Join the team on telegram

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: The Codex Protocol is built on the Ethereum network. In terms of transparency, collectibles will be registered on the blockchain as an ERC271 token which is a non-fungible token. These tokens emulate rare and collectible items. Collectors will have full control over their items, meaning they will give permission to auction houses or galleries to put their items for sale as an example. As a buyer, you will be able to view the history of the item that you're interested in. Hope this answers your question

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Scalability is a problem for the blockchain technology in a general. It's like when the internet was at 56kb/sec years ago. For now, Ethereum is a sufficient option and once the Codex developers feel the need for an upgrade then they will transition the network.  These smart contracts are needed so users/entities can interact with each other on the Codex platform.

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Good question  So the Codex Protocol is built on top of the Ethereum network. There are no plans for building a special blockchain for Codex at the moment. Ethereum is the most popular platform even though there are scalability challenges. Codex is not worried about scalability right now as the transactions are low volume but have a high value.     There are 4 smart contracts:  1: CodexCoin which is an ERC-20 utility token 2: Codex Registry, which is the ERC-721 smart contract (Non-Fungible Token Standard) 3: The staking contract, where token holders can stake tokens to receive a discount on token fees 4: The proxy contracts, from which the core contracts are accessed through  These contracts were implemented already on the Rinkeby testnet.

Body: US and Chinese residents are restricted.  Quote from: topormne on July 24, 2018, 04:16:30 PM Quote from: Misha87 on July 24, 2018, 03:40:15 PM And I want to understand your system How can I use it? And tell me please how does blockchain work?  Could you tell me too, how does the blockchain works ? I want to understand his algorithm of action and what is it I'm just starting to understand this topic. And much for me is still unclear Blockchain is an open distributed ledger where people can verify transactions that cannot be modified; CODX is an ERC-20 token on the Ethereum blockchain and you'll be using it to (for example) bid on crypto via Biddable (integrated by partners) in a secure manner. There's also Codex Viewer; Used to create and manage blockchain identities for your unique assets. You can keep these private or make them publically viewable (on a Codex Viewer gallery for example).  Here is a simple but effective explanation of a traditional blockchain: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SSo_EIwHSd4

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex Protocol is a decentralized title registry for the Art and Collectibles asset class (AKA A&C). Meaning every piece of A&C (such as art, wine, jewelry, watches, collectible cars, etc) will be able to be registered in the blockchain. Registering an item in the blockchain will store ownership and provenance information while ensuring the privacy of the collector.  The first two applications built on the Codex Protocol are Biddable and Sellable. Developers are welcomed to build more applications. You will be able to use these applications to bid and sell art and collectibles.  The best way to learn more about blockchain technology is by reading and watching Youtube videos. I recommend that you start by checking this channel out https://www.youtube.com/user/aantonop  Here's an example of how Blockchain works https://medium.freecodecamp.org/explain-bitcoin-like-im-five-73b4257ac833  Hope this helps

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Quote from: an0ma1y on July 23, 2018, 07:53:22 PM ...and i want to ask something too) Which actions I can do on your platform as common user, not programmer et cetera?  That's a great question. Add items to the Codex Protocol depends on the application that you're using to add this item. Every application will have different requirements and standards. Codex Protocol is built for collaboration and partnership across the arts & collectibles market.  There are many partners of Codex Protocol and each one of them will have an application.  There are 8 partnerships 1: Feral Horses 2: ValueMyStuff 3: Luxury Asset Capital 4: The Clarion List 5: DUST IDENTITY 6: Maecenas 7: Liveauctioneers 8: Heffel Fine  You can find more about them on the website http://www.codexprotocol.com

Author: gorogoronomi
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Simply put, a user can send their Codex Record to ValueMyStuff and receive an appraisal from the leading network of experts with prior experience at institutions like Sotheby’s and Christie’s. The amount of time the user will be able to save is tremendous, as ValueMyStuff guarantee to provide you with a valuation of your art or other collectibles within 48 hours. The partnership between Codex & ValueMyStuff brings appraisal data to a decentralized title registry for unique assets so that appraisals are carried with the asset wherever it goes.  Read the full article to find out more! https://medium.com/codexprotocol/verify-an-immutable-provenance-record-with-a-virtual-appraisal-codex-partners-with-valuemystuff-d5a811394acf

Author: imma24
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Hi there,  Codex puts provenance on the blockchain and is open source, which means that it will provide an infrastructure for all players in the A&C ecosystem who need proof of ownership while also preserving privacy. This includes bidders, sellers, as well as third-party players—including art insurers, collateralized lenders and art logisticians—who can build applications and utilize the title system. Biddable, which is a title-escrow system for the $125B auction market, is aimed toward auction houses and bidders. - For bidders, Biddable will provide access to auctions, especially for international buyers and cryptoholders who don’t have translated or verifiable financial records. - Today, auction houses lose substantial revenue to bidders who renege on items they win. Because of this, auction houses require extensive financial disclosures from potential bidders just to participate. Biddable will eliminate the need for this invasive process through the use of the title-escrow system.

Author: ribenapurpz
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: The Codex Protocol and CodexCoin will be adopted as the only cryptocurrency by The Codex Consortium, a group of major stakeholders in the A&C space who facilitate over $6 Billion in sales to millions of bidders across tens of thousands of auctions from 5,000 auction houses in over 50 countries.  Not only this, they have a strong team that has come from other successful businesses and the team's advisor list has some heavy hitters in the Art and Collectables industry including Brook Hazelton, President, Christie's America.  Want to learn more? Talk to the team on telegram: https://t.me/codexprotocol

Author: ribenapurpz
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Hi there, you will need a few things.  Goto https://www.codexprotocol.com/token-sale.html and sign up for the sale day 2, which will be held on 25th July  Pass through KYC. You will need to provide ID and proof of address  You will need Ethereum or ETH to contribute and an ERC-20 compatible wallet.  If you need help with any of this talk to a member of the support team on telegram here: https://t.me/codexprotocol

Author: JSON
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: I guess it will be very easy to do (hope so). Also interesting point is claims. What if someone bought an bad item? Not fake, but just damager or something like that. Will the platform join a dispute?

Author: DutchTranslator
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex itself won't be responsible for managing disputes. As you probably know, you can add photos to records. Adding clear photo's of all angles should combat this (including support by validators doing what they do best). However, (future) 3rd-party companies whom have integrated the protocol might handle disputes according to their own terms. Regarding existing partnered platforms, it is worth checking out who's who on the main website and then follow their links to lookup their terms related to disputes

Author: gorogoronomi
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex Protocol announces new ecosystem members providing services to the Fine Arts Industry! "New partners include Heffel Fine Art Auction House, Feral Horses, Luxury Asset Capital, ValueMyStuff, Dust, and The Clarion List. Through interactions with pieces on the protocol holding the Codex Record, members will utilize or write on the title registry, thereby contributing to the pieces’ provenance.  Much more news incoming as Codex's received many partnership inquiries and look forward to sharing more on this front with the community in the coming weeks.  Read full article: https://www.globalbankingandfinance.com/codex-protocol-announces-new-ecosystem-members-providing-services-to-fine-arts-industry/

Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles

Jess Houlgrave spoke at Christie's Art + Tech Summit in London this week. The response to blockchain in the Art World has been incredible.  “More transparency equals more trust, more trust equals more transactions, more transactions equals stronger markets,” Anne Bracegirdle, a specialist in the photographs department at Christie’s, said on Tuesday at the auction house’s first Art & Tech Summit, dedicated to exploring blockchain.  https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/20/arts/blockchain-fintech-art-funds.html?utm_content=74606360&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter

Second day of the sale is open to all eligible participants, check out this link: https://www.codexprotocol.com/token-sale.html  Quote from: zhouxianli on July 19, 2018, 05:21:07 PM What are the advantages of codex solutions? you should interest buyers of tokens! Author: ribenapurpz
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex is the leading decentralized asset registry for the $2 trillion arts & collectibles (“A&C”) ecosystem, which includes art, fine wine, collectible cars, antiques, decorative arts, coins, watches, jewelry, and more. Powered by the CodexCoin native token, the Codex Protocol is open source, allowing third-party players in the A&C ecosystem to build applications and utilize the title system. Codex has launched two initial decentralized apps (beta), Biddable, providing access to unique assets for crypto-holders, and Codex Viewer, to create and manage blockchain identities for your unique assets. The Codex Protocol and CodexCoin will be adopted as the only cryptocurrency by The Codex Consortium, a group of major stakeholders in the A&C space who facilitate over $6 Billion in sales to millions of bidders across tens of thousands of auctions from 5,000 auction houses in over 50 countries. https://www.codexprotocol.com.  This is a great introduction to Codex Protocol if you wanted to find out more: https://medium.com/codexprotocol/how-codex-makes-art-collectibles-easier-160e538e65c0

Author: RonMank
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex Community, After receiving great feedback for the Testnet beta through our Codex Quests, Earndrops, and bug bounty programs, and with a security audit of our smart contracts complete, we're thrilled to announce that we will launch The Codex Viewer to Mainnet by midnight (CST) on July 23rd, 2018. Deploying the production version of the Codex Viewer is an incredible milestone for Codex and we're thrilled to share our product with our growing community.     ________________________________________   Token Generation Event We have updated the terms of the TGE We have completed our private sale, which has provided us with sufficient resources to reach our initial goals. We now look forward to completing our public sale so we can begin supporting the long list of partners and projects who are ready to build upon and integrate into Codex Protocol. To that end, we are glad to announce our finalized public sale schedule and terms, including a revised hard cap and an updated token price that is more favorable to our token buyer community. To further reward our community, the first ⅓ of the public sale will have a 15% bonus. The token sale will open at 12:00 UTC on Tuesday, July 24th. Participants who completed the KYC process during our whitelist week will receive first access to the sale for 24 hours, after which anyone may contribute. If you plan to contribute and have not already whitelisted, we encourage you to complete KYC now to ensure you get access as early as possible.

Author: saendom
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Hello friends. How are you doing? Today I wanted to discuss the following question of interest to me: will the identity of the owner remain secret?

Author: lordyyk
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Hey. Excellent. Regarding your question, I think that it is. This is one of the main conditions of this business.

Author: saendom
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: But how then will the movement of the object be traced?

Author: lordyyk
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: He will be assigned his serial number and all of his past and future history of buying and selling will be fixed in the detachment.

Author: saendom
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Clear. Do you think there will be problems with the initial import of objects into the Codex database?

Author: lordyyk
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Yes, it will be painstaking, but quite feasible work.

Author: saendom
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: And how to trace the past life of a certain object?

Author: lordyyk
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Paper archives, certificates, receipts - this process can not be abandoned at the initial stage.

Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles

Author: Kaznachej123
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Dear Codex Community! Listen back to this episode of the Artelligence podcast featuring Codex 👉   https://player.fm/series/artelligence-podcast/mark-lurie-on-codex-the-blockchain-and-the-art-market    Mark Lurie is the founder of Lofty, a seller of art and collectibles online that he sold a little over a year ago. Since then, Mark, who has worked as a venture captialist as well as a founder, saw the natural fit between the art market and blockchain technology. His new venture Codex seeks to create an title registry for the art market. But Codex is more than that. It seeks to be a foundational technology for many different businesses and services in the art market. In this podcast, Mark explains his vision of the future of the art market and how we'll get there.

Author: ribenapurpz
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex Viewer is designed to enable users to register and manage assets using the Codex Protocol. For now, all assets in the registered are created manually by collectors but in the future assets flowing through auction will be provisioned automatically at the time of sale. Assets registered in the registry are called Codex Records. Each one is a unique ERC-721 token that can be created, traded, and curated all in a decentralized manner.  By default, metadata about assets registered on the protocol are private, but collectors have full control over the permissions. If the user is managing assets on behalf of a museum or gallery they may want to make everything public and available to others. The user instead could be a collector that wants to consign permissions to an auction house for a piece they are looking to sell.  Over the next few weeks of the beta, we’ll have themed days to get feedback on specific features of the application as we continue to iterate on the functionality.  Check it our for yourself here: https://beta.codex-viewer.com/#/

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex Protocol — Blockchain-based Title Registry of Art and Collectibles  Codex Protocol develops an infrastructure for creating a decentralized registry of collectibles and art. Even at the initial stage of development, the project was supported by a strong consortium of 5,000 auction houses with extensive experience in this segment. The goal is to become an industry standard.  Codex initially focused on the $ 2 trillion Art & Collectibles asset class, where the need for the registry is greatest, because there is no centralized title registry. For unique assets, the origin (identity, ownership chain and other metadata about the element) are of fundamental importance. Just imagine such a market in one application — at any time, collectors, buyers, as well as auction makers will be able to get all the necessary information about a particular work of art.  The decentralized Codex registry will allow collectors to gain confidence in the authenticity of purchased items. The platform can exist as an industry protocol and will make it possible to create decentralized applications on it. The company itself already adds to it two applications Biddable and Sellable. It should be noted that the well-known companies, as well as the auction houses, have already invested in the project — they were able to see the potential of the platform, which opens new opportunities for connoisseurs of collectibles.  Read more: https://medium.com/@Vladar49/codex-protocol-blockchain-based-title-registry-of-art-and-collectibles-2fac0c822c0c

Author: imma24
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex Protocol is a decentralized title registry for the $2 Trillion A&C asset class. The protocol will be integrated by its consortium and third party developers are encouraged to build their apps in a way that supports Codex as well. Biddable and Codex Viewer are the protocols' native apps developed by Codex Labs INC. Biddable lets you register and pay for A&C with cryptocurrency with over 5000 auction houses around the world. Codex Viewer will allow users to view and interact with the Codex.  Interacting with the protocol requires Codex Coin for actions such as modifying and transferring Codex Records. These fees will be absorbed by Codex Protocol and a percentage of this will go to a community fund to boost adoption. There are a number of incentive levers: Users who maintain a stake of CodexCoin will receive discounts on protocol fees to ensure affordability for applications and engagement with governance. Rewards (for example: validators verifying record provenance), penalties (staking to deter bad behaviour) and governance (open community that governs a decentralized system, in the beginning this will be at the discretion of the consortium and Codex Labs, INC.)

Author: ribenapurpz
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Here’s how it works with Codex: Bob emails you and offers his Picasso. You ask him to share access to the Codex Record. Instantly, you can see that Christie’s auction house created the Codex Record, the artist’s foundation digitally signed it, and the Record hasn’t been copied (because it’s on the blockchain). You can confidently make an offer instantly. Business is also easier. Brokers can sell items more easily, the costs of each sale are lower, loans can be extended more quickly, and more.  This is what makes Codex so much better than the status quo. And this comparison is critical — we believe people adopt new technology when it is 10x better than before. We don’t claim that everything in the Codex is perfect, because that is neither necessary nor possible.  View the full post here about how Codex is making the art world easier to access: https://medium.com/codexprotocol/how-codex-makes-art-collectibles-easier-160e538e65c0

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Take a moment to view this great Hacked article about Insights from the Crypto Markets: Price Traps & Early-Stage Project Investments  Featuring Codex Protocol:  The criteria for blockchain-based projects is much higher than a pure concept. Projects with functioning products and strategic partnerships tend to be much more appealing. Take Codex Protocol, for example. The decentralized title registry for the art and collectibles industry has already proven its ability to tackle the digital collectibles and art provenance industries and held a successful art auction in April at the Ethereal Summit (the one where a Cryptokitty got sold for $140k)  View the full piece here: https://hacked.com/insights-from-the-crypto-markets-price-traps-early-stage-project-investments/

Author: phamhuyenmy2504
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Codex (PreICO) Unlock the Value of Unique Assets Codex is the leading decentralized asset registry for the $2 trillion arts & collectibles (“A&C”) ecosystem, which includes art, fine wine, collectible cars, antiques, decorative arts, coins, watches, jewelry, and more. Powered by the CodexCoin native token, the Codex Protocol is open source, allowing third-party players in the A&C ecosystem to build applications and utilize the registry. These applications, built with Codex’s partners, will make buying, selling, insurance, asset-backed loans and shipping and logistics easier for everyone. Codex’s first application, Biddable, is a title-escrow system built on the Codex Protocol, which solves long-standing challenges in auctions: non-performing bidders, lack of privacy, and bidder access. It is already live with the Codex Consortium, a group of major stakeholders in the A&C space who facilitate over $6 Billion in sales to millions of bidders across tens of thousands of auctions from 5,000 auction houses in over 50 countries.  SOURCE:https://icobench.com/ico/codex

Author: ribenapurpz
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Jess gave this update on the Codex whitelisting so far:  Thanks for your patience today! The great news is that we had well over 1000 people register in the first six hours of the whitelist.  We are however dealing with a backlog of KYC verification for those who weren't automatically approved. You will receive an email from us as soon you we've processed it which will either show that you've been approved or rejected.  If you have been rejected, you may try again. Please make sure - the whole of your identity document is visible - the spelling of your name in the forms matches the identity document - that your identity document has not expired - that you are not resident in the US or China - That your selfie photograph clearly shows your whole face  As a reminder, no-one from Codex, or Amazix will EVER ask for you to send them ETH or personal information. If in doubt, please contact a group admin.  Thanks for your ongoing support!  To make sure you don't miss updates like this, join the telegram now! https://t.me/codexprotocol

Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Both. For already existent items the validates in the network: auction houses, appraisers etc. Can provide attestations and documentation to support the item’s provenance.

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: “We’re thrilled to partner with The Clarion List to make the process for servicing artworks and collectibles as simple as possible. By utilizing the Codex Record to verify authenticity, value, and even location, the parties involved in the service can be certain that all of this information is accurate,” CEO of Codex, Mark Lurie  Read more here https://medium.com/codexprotocol/efficient-quotes-for-art-services-codex-partners-with-the-clarion-list-835f455487d6

Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Wondering how long the ICO will run eventually. I am considering joining the bounty program, but this will depend on the run-time of the ICO. Since the available rewards for the signature are only $50k, the amount of weeks that we have to work is important to know.

Author: DutchTranslator
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: Jess responded the following to this exact question in the Telegram: ''We expect it to be 4 weeks max but we will announce this after the whitelist period.''  Also, Codex is hiring engineers! Be sure to check out the jobs page on angel.co for more info: https://angel.co/codexprotocol/jobs/

Author: imma24
Title: [ANN] Codex Protocol - Decentralized Registry for Art & Collectibles
Body: CodeXProtocol Vs 0xCertProtocol  0xCert is very similar to Codex, they want to register unique assets on the Blockchain. And a few weeks ago they talked for the first time about art. But they don’t have anyone with industry experience or connections and have no relationships with the art world. They don’t seem to have any adoption strategy for getting people in the A&C ecosystem to use them.
